abstract: At Valentino, Pierpaolo Piccioli plays with expectations.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — It’s been a strange, discombobulating dance at the couture, sneaking glances between shows at the impeachment proceedings going on in the United States, the spread of coronavirus in China, and the plutocrats talking sustainability at Davos. World events have a way of raising the stakes on a collection; what can a designer do to really merit any attention at all?
